pages.text: You remember the blocks that shielded your precious gemstones from external influences? Those black and white materials look really pretty, so you designed some decoration blocks from their materials.$(br2)Maybe they also absorbed some of the magical properties of the minerals themselves? Who knows.
When smelted, the bright color of calcite comes out even more. Smelting Smooth Basalt also results in a much cleaner texture, which is perfect for building.

pages.title: Polished Basalt Blocks
pages.text: The dark gray basalt surrounding the geodes is a wonderful contrast to the bright hues of the calcite.$(br)When smelted, it almost turns black.

pages.title: Polished Calcite Blocks
pages.text: The bright white of calcite may be the brightest natural material you've stumbled across.$(br)It looks very clean and radiates dignity.

pages.title: Tuff Blocks
pages.text: While you were searching for geodes underground, you also stumbled across tuff.$(br)After you've collected a whole bunch of it, it can't hurt to make some additional shapes out of this material, too.
By applying heat, all blocks can be converted back to their polished versions again.
